Detailed outline

detailedoutline.Rmd

Week 13

Before class:

S Content PDF Videos SAS R
7a Survival analysis and censoring
7b Likelihood for survival data
7c Kaplan-Meier estimator
7d Cox proportional hazard model
7e Log rank test

In class:

  • Exercise 7.1

Week 12

Before class:

S Content PDF Videos SAS R
6e Random slope
6f Prediction for mixed models

In class:

  • Theoretical review
    • conditional and marginal predictions
    • nested random effects
    • partial pooling (blog post)
  • Analysis of chick growth curves: SAS and R code

After class:

  • Nested versus crossed effects (optional reading)

Week 11

Before class:

S Content PDF Videos SAS R
6b Clustered data example
6c Random effects
6d Random intercept

In class:

  • Theoretical review of mixed models
    • marginal versus conditional mean
    • model equation
    • REML versus ML (model comparison)
  • Workshop: models for CD4 counts

Week 10

Before class:

S Content PDF Videos SAS R
5g Selection of covariance structures
5h Group heteroscedasticity
6a Group effects
  • Restricted estimation maximum likelihood
  • Dependence graph of different covariance models
  • AR(1) model with irregular time steps
  • Workshop: testing restrictions
  • ANOVA with unequal variance

Week 9

Before class:

S Content PDF Videos SAS R
5b Example of longitudinal data
5c Model formulation
5d Compound symmetry covariance
5e Autoregressive covariance
5f Other covariance models

In class:

  • Discussion of features of longitudinal data: example code from Rick Wicklin
  • Workshop: examples of longitudinal data and a description of datasets
  • Transforming data from wide to long format

Week 8

Before class:

S Content PDF Videos SAS R
4g Rates and offsets
4h Logistic model for proportions
5a Introduction to correlated data

In class:

  • Poisson/binomial analysis for sweden.
  • Models for contingency tables (not covered)
  • Rates - Exercise 4.3 (children ever born)
  • Overdispersion - slides (see Exercise 4.4 for an example)

Week 7

Before class:

S Content PDF Videos SAS R
4d Poisson regression
4e Contingency tables
4f Overdispersion
  • Course notes: Section 4.3 (excluding 4.3.3)

In class:

  • Review of Assignment 1
  • Logistic regression with SAS

Week 6

Before class:

S Content PDF Videos SAS R
4a Generalized linear models
4b Logistic regression
4c Example of logistic regression
  • Course notes: Sections 2.10, 4.1-4.2

In class:

  • Overview of the theory of generalized linear models.
  • Example of Box-Cox regression
  • Midterm survey.

Week 5

Before class:

S Content Slides PDF Videos SAS R
2h Collinearity
2i Diagnostic plots
  • Course notes: chapter 2 (sections 8 and 9)

In class:

  • Collinearity illustration with wages85 data
  • Graphical analysis of residuals for college data (code)
  • Workshop on diagnostic plots

Week 4

Before class:

S Content PDF Videos SAS R
2e Coefficient of determination
2f Predictions
2g Interactions
  • Course notes: chapter 2 (section 5-7)

In class:

  • Workshop on interactions (Exercise 2.8)

After class:

  • Tests of linear hypothesis in SAS: theory, R code, SAS code
  • Exercises 2.5-2.7

Week 3

Before class:

S Content PDF Videos SAS R
2d Hypothesis tests
3 Likelihood-based inference
  • Course notes: chapter 3, chapter 2 (section 4)

In class:

  • R demo: sampling distribution of OLS, profile likelihood for individual coefficients
  • Interpretation of SAS output and tests for the insurance data
  • Understanding Maximum Likelihood by Kristoffer Magnusson

After class

  • Exercise sheet 3
  • Tests as linear models

Week 2

Before class:

Recording 2c is optional

S Content Slides PDF Videos SAS R
2a Parameter interpretation
2b Linear transformations
2c Geometry of least squares
  • Course notes: chapter 2 (sections 1-3)

In class

  • Parameter interpretation (intention data, full model)
  • EDA of the insurance data and construction of a linear model
  • Code to create added-variable plots
  • xkcd comic strip: Curve-fitting

After class:

  • Exercises 2.1-2.4

Week 1

Before class:

S Content Slides PDF Videos SAS R
0 Course Outline
1a Hypothesis Tests
1b Central Limit Theorem
1c Exploratory Data Analysis
  • Course notes: chapter 1 and Appendix A
  • Create an account on SAS onDemand
  • Complete the Introduction to SAS

In class:

  • Presentation and practice of pedagogical tools (Zoom / Etherpad / Wooclap / SAS onDemand)
  • Graphics workshop (group)

After class:

  • intro quiz (self-assessment)
  • Exercise 1.4 (a-b) with SAS. The whole exercise sheet may be somewhat difficult at this stage, but you should (be able to) complete it in the upcoming weeks.

Additional readings:

  • Chapter 1 of Data Visualization: A practical introduction by Kieran Healy
  • Permutation tests
  • DataViz Cheatsheet
  • Chapter 7 of R for Data Science by Garrett Grolemund and Hadley Wickham

Other references:

  • Chapter 3 of R for Data Science by Garrett Grolemund and Hadley Wickham
  • Fundamentals of Data Visualization by Claus O. Wilke
